episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a variety of quirky and historical facts, including a cheese riot in Nottingham, the peculiar eating habits of baby robins, Lenin's unexpected Irish accent, and a unique Japanese service where you can hire someone to take the blame for your mistakes at work.

facts.fact: In 1766, there was a cheese riot in Nottingham, where the mayor of Nottingham was knocked over by a large cheese.
Baby robins sometimes eat so many caterpillars they turn green.
The Russian Communist leader, Vladimir Lenin, spoke with an Irish accent.
In Japan, if you make a mistake at work, you can hire someone to get told off by your boss so you don't have to.
